What are some limitations to be aware of when working with multi-currency in Verus, and what are the implications of these limitations?

When working with multi-currency in Verus, there are two main limitations to be aware of:

**Limitation 1: Using I-Addresses as Currency Names**
One limitation is that you cannot create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, rather than its calculated ID. This means that if an ID has an i-address as its name, it will cause problems when trying to use that i-address or name in various cases. This is because the naming system will interpret an i-address as referring to the currency or identity that has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. While it is not prevented by the protocol, using an i-address as a currency name is not supported and will lead to issues. To avoid confusion, the naming system will also be expanding the set of characters that are not allowed for currency registrations.

**Limitation 2: Conflicting Currency Names in GUI**
Another limitation, specific to the GUI, is that if a currency is already supported in the Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This means that you cannot create a PBaaS chain with the same name as an existing supported currency. This limitation is considered errata and will be addressed before mainnet availability.
